article.headline: Savannah State 70, Longwood 69
article.story: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) -- Javon Randolph hit a jumper with five seconds left and scored 21 of Savannah State's last 23 points in a 70-69 victory over Longwood on Saturday. Randolph, who finished with 34 points, helped the Tigers (2-18) beat a NCAA Division I team for the first time since their 60-50 defeat of Bethune-Cookman on Jan. 22, 2003. Savannah State's other win came in its first game against NAIA Wilberforce this season. The Tigers finished last season 0-28, making them the second winless Division I team in the last half-century. Savannah State joined Prairie View, which went 0-28 in 1991-92. Savannah State was 4-24 two years ago, but the Tigers forfeited all four victories because they used an ineligible player. Longwood had a four-point lead at halftime. The Lancers (3-16) went up 60-49 on a jumper by Maurice Sumter with 6:35 remaining in the second half. But Savannah State answered with a 19-9 run the next six minutes, then Randolph hit the game-deciding shot. Randolph went 14-of-21 from the field. Maurice Hunter led Longwood with 22 points. Clayton Morgan, who went 12-of-17 from the line, had 18 points and grabbed 10 rebounds, while Kirk Williams added 11 points. Terry Hill scored 10 points for Savannah State.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
